subject: Re:
preview: Thanks for the follow up Heath. A few more questions to help us understand our position.  How long do you think we have until we absolutely need to rebuild the site? We're hoping to keep it as is unti

full_threads.body:
Thanks for the follow up Heath. A few more questions to help us understand our position.

How long do you think we have until we absolutely need to rebuild the site? We're hoping to keep it as is until Jan so we're not disturbing our busiest period but we don't want to risk it if you think the site can go down any day of the week.

Does having Sucuri on staff help mitigate the risk and vulnerability?

In your professional opinion, what would be the expected cost of rebuilding the site as is into WooCommerce or Shopify?

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

Thanks for your time earlier and the chat. 

As mentioned here are the key reasons why will respectively decline to work on the current australiathegift.com.au website:

  • The website appears to have evolved overtime and potentially had a few different companies working on it. This tends to create overlaps and introduce security issues. It's quite difficult to reverse engineer as we are not across the business requirements or history. This means we can't simply 'turn elements off' as we don't know if they are still required or not. 
  • The many plugins represent a potential security threat for the website to get hacked. They are like leaving a house or car window unlocked... An open invitation of sorts. Many of the plugins are not actively maintained by the developers/owners of the plugin code so will become vulnerable at one point or another. It's not a case of maybe, but a case of when. 
  • The site is extremely slow, particularly in the backend. We can speed this up, but the main cause of the slowness is from the plugins that have been installed as 'band aids' to either enhance the security, add some sort of feature or to cover up a gap. It's nearly impossible to efficiently work on a website that is in this condition. 
My advice would be to have a consultation with the client to determine the key features that the website requires. You can then look to start fresh and rebuild from the ground up with the full business case or picture in mind. This way only the required features and functionality make the cut and the rest are left behind. Depending on the business case, either Shopify or WooCommerce will work for this client as they have a fairly traditional ecomm model. There is nothing too complex about buy/building their products online. 

We spent 8 hrs yesterday trying to find some ways to make this work for them, but, I feel that with this clients sales volume and online success, it's too risky to add more bandaids. Although totally 'do-able', I would not be honestly setting them up for future success and that didn't sit well with myself and my team. 

I do wish you and ATG all the best and of course, I'm here as a resource to bounce ideas etc.

All makes sense mate.

What's the earliest or latest possible time we could do the downtime? It would be preferable to us to have the downtime between midnight and 6am.

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

She sure is a beast of a site. 

We have been familiarising ourselves with the ins and outs and how to get some speed/performance gains. 

We have a plan of attack, but, it will require some 'down' time (i,e, we will put an 'under maintenance' screen up) whilst we do the eventual transition over. Reason being, that they are getting up to 5-6 orders an hour and we don't want to miss any of them, or have someone part way through an order and then get bumped. 

The downtime would be approx 30mins - 1hr and we can do it after hours when less shoppers will be online. Does this work for you/the client? 

The alternative would to pay for some premium plugins to import and export the orders that come through during the migration period. This would result in a couple of minutes of downtime (max), but the plugins are circa $158USD. 

Please let me know your preference? Happy to chat further about this also.

Hi Heath,

We are hosting through Cloudways and I just sent you access to the backend - that should hopefully give you FTP access.

Use that email address for authentication.

Thanks,

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

I just tried to call you. 

I have tried to login to GoDaddy, but there is 2 factor authentication. Please see attached and let me know which option will be best for us to use. 

Also, do you know if the website is hosting with GoDaddy as well? We have tried our normal way of cloning the site, but it's in such bad shape that it's maxing out the current server's resources. We will need to take a copy via FTP. So if you have the FTP details, can you please send them over to me also? Or if it's hosted with GoDaddy, once I'm in there I can retrieve them myself.

Feel free to call if the above needs clarification.

Legend thanks Kurt. 

We will get started shortly and I'll keep you in the loop on progress.

Done.

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Awesome, welcome aboard!! 

We just need these details and we can get started: https://wpperk.com/onboard/

Let me know if you need hand with this.

Great, thanks.

I've just purchased the Pro Plan. Ready to get going ASAP.

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

You can use this email chain as proof of the agreement.

That's great thanks Heath. Is there a promo code that I should use to ensure the 3 month minimum term is upheld when making payment?

What's the best way to move forward with that.

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

Yes, totally fine I agree to the 3 month minimum, no probs. We've all been there and I'm confident that you will surpass this period : ) 

The rest of your points are all spot on. Only thing to clarify: 
  • If we need anything added to the site we need to go through WP Perk.
You/your client (anyone with a login really) will still have access to the backend as well. So we say use our team for the more technical requirements or those that take a lot of grunt work. Hope that clears it up.

Hi Heath, Hope you are well. Thanks again for your time the other day. Happy to say we would like to proceed ahead. Before doing so, I was about to make payment and saw there is a 12 month minimum term for the Pro Plan. Can we please make that a 3 month minimum term as a trial? The reason for that is because we want to mitigate the risk on our end and the company has had a bad experience before being locked into an agreement. All help is appreciated here to get this over the line. ==== In the meantime, below are my notes from the call. If there is anything that is correct please let me know: Onboarding process - Consolidating and cleaning up the site to get the plugins working and loading as quick as possible. Support
  • If we need anything added to the site we need to go through WP Perk.
  • Anything 30mins and under is done on the same business day.
  • 2hrs per month of developer time each month. Overage fee is $99 per hour but they'll let us know beforehand.
Maintenance - 1st of each month we get a report detailing all the work that has been done. Team of 10 people and we'll be dealing with either Heath, Reeka or Joel. Heath is in charge of all client onboarding. Kurt Sorensen Director - Backpack Digital
Perfect! Have a good weekend and speak soon!

Thanks Heath - my number is 0422273757.

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hi Kurt, 

Yes sure, Monday works best for me. 

I will send a calendar invite for 2:30pm shortly.

Thanks for this Heath.

It'd be great to get a call in to discuss the Pro Plan further before proceeding. Do you have 15 mins in the below?

Mon 7th between 2pm and 4pm
Wed 9th between 1pm and 4pm

I am based in Brisbane so I am 1 hour behind you (if you're I am assuming correctly you are in Sydney).

Thanks,

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital

Hey Kurt, 

I have attached a high-level audit of your client's website for your reference. Some of the items, particularly on the SEO side of things, need more context (e.g. the targeted keywords we have used for the report may not be your focus at the moment). But there may be some other useful insights for you. 

Let me know if you have any other questions, happy to help.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Kurt,

Yes the above would be included in our Pro Plan. If we uncover some areas that may take us over the 2 hrs for this month we will let you know. Most of the time we can get the site in good shape within the 2 hrs though. 

Yes, price is inc GST and once you sign up, you will receive an email requesting logins. When we receive that we get started on the same business day : )

Hope that all sounds good to you? Let me know if you have any other questions? 

Thanks,

Thanks for the response Heath. Website is https://www.australiathegift.com.au/

To confirm, all the services you outlined in your previous email would be covered in your Pro plan which is $250 per month? Does that cost include GST?

If we did engage your services when would you be able to start?

Kurt Sorensen
Director - Backpack Digital
